article.p: Articles are fragments of HTML5 documents. The simplest article is structured as follows:

The article publication time is parsed from the datetime attribute of the last time tag in the first header. The title is parsed from the first hn tag (where n = 1–4), as is the author from the address tag. These are used to order articles on the main page and title the article page. Both of these are optional — the system will default to Untitled article, Unknown author, and the file's ctime, if no information is otherwise provided.
Articles are linked into a front page as follows (and omitting the surrounding HTML stuff):
The article tags are replaced by ordered article data, with a little permanent link thing following. The rest is up to you.
